cluster_name.description: An unique identifier for the head node and workers of this cluster.

min_workers.description: The minimum number of workers nodes to launch in addition to the head node. This number should be >= 0

max_workers.description: The maximum number of workers nodes to launch in addition to the head node. This takes precedence over min_workers.

initial_workers.description: The number of workers to launch initially, in addition to the head node.

autoscaling_mode.description: The mode of the autoscaler e.g. default, aggressive

target_utilization_fraction.description: The autoscaler will scale up the cluster to this target fraction of resources usage. For example, if a cluster of 8 nodes is 100% busy # and target_utilization was 0.8, it would resize the cluster to 10.

idle_timeout_minutes.description: If a node is idle for this many minutes, it will be removed.

module.description: module, if using external node provider

head_ip.description: gcp project id, if using gcp

msi_identity_principal_id.description: User-defined managed identity principal id (generated by config)

autoscaler_service_account.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

autoscaler_role.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

autoscaler_role_binding.description: k8s autoscaler permissions, if using k8s

cache_stopped_nodes.description: Whether to try to reuse previously stopped nodes instead of launching nodes. This will also cause the autoscaler to stop nodes instead of terminating them. Only implemented for AWS.

auth.description: How Ray will authenticate with newly launched nodes.

docker.description: Docker configuration. If this is specified, all setup and start commands will be executed in the container.

run_options.description: shared options for starting head/worker docker

head_image.description: image for head node, takes precedence over 'image' if specified

head_run_options.description: head specific run options, appended to run_options

head_node.description: Provider-specific config for the head node, e.g. instance type.

worker_nodes.description: Provider-specific config for worker nodes. e.g. instance type.

file_mounts.description: Map of remote paths to local paths, e.g. {"/tmp/data": "/my/local/data"}

initialization_commands.description: List of commands that will be run before `setup_commands`. If docker is enabled, these commands will run outside the container and before docker is setup.

setup_commands.description: List of common shell commands to run to setup nodes.

head_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on the head node after common setup.

worker_setup_commands.description: Commands that will be run on worker nodes after common setup.

head_start_ray_commands.description: Command to start ray on the head node. You shouldn't need to modify this.

worker_start_ray_commands.description: Command to start ray on worker nodes. You shouldn't need to modify this.

no_restart.description: Whether to avoid restarting the cluster during updates. This field is controlled by the ray --no-restart flag and cannot be set by the user.
